verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:172
verses.text: ; Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:173
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:175
verses.text: ); the man's wisdom was great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:176
verses.text: Howbeit it is not the same thing to guide men who are already philosophers, and to rule unreasoning children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:177
verses.text: And, if you are inclined to hear yet another particular; as the nurse says to the child, When thou easest thyself, take up thy garments, and for as long as thou sittest, so also did Moses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:178
verses.text: (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:179
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:180
verses.text: ) For all the passions are tyrannous in children (for as yet they have not that which is to bridle them), vainglory, desire, irrationality, anger, envy; just as in children, so they prevailed; they spat upon, they beat, Moses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:181
verses.text: And as a child takes up a stone, and we all exclaim, O do not throw it; so did they also take up stones against their father; and he fled from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:182
verses.text: And as, if a father have any ornament, the child, being fond of ornament, asks him for it, in like manner, truly, did the party of Dathan and Abiram act, when they rebelled for the priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:183
verses.text: (Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:184
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:185
verses.text: ) And besides, they were of all people the most envious, and little-minded, and in all respects imperfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:186
verses.text: Ought then Christ, tell me, to have appeared at that time, at that time to have given them these teachings of true wisdom, when they were raging with lust, when they were as horses mad for the mare, when they were the slaves of money, of the belly? Nay, He would but have wasted his lessons of wisdom in discoursing with those of no understanding; and they would have neither learnt one thing nor the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:187
verses.text: And as he who teaches to read before he has taught the alphabet, will never teach even so much as the alphabet; so indeed would it then have been also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:188
verses.text: But not so now, for by the grace of God much forbearance, much virtue, hath been planted everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:189
verses.text: Let us give thanks then for all things, and not be over curious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:190
verses.text: For it is not we that know the due time, but He, The Maker of the time, and The Creator of the ages.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:191
verses.text: In everything then yield we to Him: for this is to glorify God, not to demand of Him an account of what He doeth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:192
verses.text: In this way too did Abraham give glory to God; "And being fully persuaded," we read, "that what He had promised, He was able to perform".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:193
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:194
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:195
verses.text: ) He did not ask about the future even; but we scrutinize the account even of the past.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:196
verses.text: See how great folly, how great ingratitude, is here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 5:197
verses.text: But let us for the future have done, for no gain comes of it, but much harm even; and let our minds be gratefully disposed towards our Master, and let us send up glory to God, that making for all things an offering of thanksgiving, we may be counted worthy of His lovingkindness, through the grace and love toward man of His Only-begotten, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:1
verses.text: Homily V.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:2
verses.text: Colossians i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:3
verses.text: –  "Even the mystery which hath been hid from all ages and generations: but now hath it been manifested to His saints, to whom God was pleased to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory: whom we proclaim, admonishing every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:4
verses.text: Having said what we have come to, and showed the lovingkindness of God and the honor, by the greatness of the things given, he introduces yet another consideration that heightens them, namely, that neither before us did any one know Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:5
verses.text: As he doth also in the Epistle to the Ephesians, saying, neither Angels, nor principalities, nor any other created power, but only the Son of God knew.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:6
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:7
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:9
verses.text: ) And he said, not simply hid, but "quite hid," and that even if it hath but now come to pass, yet it is of old, and from the beginning God willed these things, and they were so planned out; but why, he saith not yet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:10
verses.text: "From the ages," from the beginning, as one might say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:11
verses.text: And with reason he calleth that a mystery, which none knew, save God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:12
verses.text: And where hid? In Christ; as he saith in the Epistle to the Ephesians (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:13
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:14
verses.text: ), or as when the Prophet saith, "From everlasting even to everlasting Thou art".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:15
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:16
verses.text: xc.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:17
verses.text: ) But now hath been manifested, he saith, "to His saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:18
verses.text: So that it is altogether of the dispensation of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:19
verses.text: "But now hath been manifested," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:20
verses.text: He saith not, "is come to pass," but, "hath been manifested to His saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:21
verses.text: So that it is even now still hid, since it hath been manifested to His saints alone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:22
verses.text: Let not others therefore deceive you, for they know not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:23
verses.text: Why to them alone? "To whom He was pleased," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:24
verses.text: See how everywhere He stops the mouth of their questions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:25
verses.text: "To whom God was pleased to make known," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:26
verses.text: Yet His will is not without reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:27
verses.text: By way of making them accountable for grace, rather than allowing them to have high thoughts, as though it were of their own achieving, he said, "To whom he was pleased to make known".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:28
verses.text: "What is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:29
verses.text: He hath spoken loftily, and accumulated emphasis, seeking, out of his great earnestness, for amplification upon amplification.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:30
verses.text: For this also is an amplification, the saying indefinitely, "The riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:31
verses.text: For it is most of all apparent among the Gentiles, as he also says elsewhere, "And that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:32
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:33
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:34
verses.text: ) For the great glory of this mystery is apparent among others also, but much more among these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:35
verses.text: For, on a sudden, to have brought men more senseless than stones to the dignity of Angels, simply through bare words, and faith alone, without any laboriousness, is indeed glory and riches of mystery: just as if one were to take a dog, quite consumed with hunger and the mange, foul, and loathsome to see, and not so much as able to move, but lying cast out, and make him all at once into a man, and to display him upon the royal throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:36
verses.text: They were wont to worship stones and the earth; but they learned that themselves are better both than the heaven and the sun, and that the whole world serveth them; they were captives and prisoners of the devil: on a sudden they are placed above his head, and lay commands on him and scourge him: from being captives and slaves to demons, they are become the body of The Master of the Angels and the Archangels; from not knowing even what God is, they are become all at once sharers even in God's throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:37
verses.text: Wouldest thou see the countless steps they overleaped? First, they had to learn that stones are not gods; secondly, that they not only are not gods, but inferior even to men; thirdly, to brutes even; fourthly, to plants even; fifthly, they brought together the extremes: that not only stones but not earth even, nor animals, nor plants, nor man, nor heaven; or, to begin again, that not stones, not animals, not plants, not elements, not things above, not things below, not man, not demons, not Angels, not Archangels, not any of those Powers above, ought to be worshiped by the nature of man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:38
verses.text: Being drawn up, as it were, from some deep, they had to learn that the Lord of all, He is God, that Him alone is it right to worship; that the virtuous life is a good thing; that this present death is not death, nor this life, life; that the body is raised, that it becomes incorruptible, that it will ascend into heaven, that it obtains even immortality, that it standeth with Angels, that it is removed thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:39
verses.text: But Him who was there below, having cleared at a bound all these steps, He has placed on high upon the throne, having made Him that was lower than the stones, higher in dominion than the Angels, and the Archangels, and the thrones, and the dominions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:40
verses.text: Truly "What is the riches of the glory of this mystery?" Just as if one should show a fool to be all at once made a philosopher; yea rather, whatsoever one should say, it would be as nothing: for even the words of Paul are undefined.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:41
verses.text: "What is the riches," he saith, "of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you?" Again, they had to learn that He who is above, and who ruleth Angels and dominions, and all the other Powers, came down below, and was made Man, and suffered countless things, and rose again, and was received up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:42
verses.text: All these things were of the mystery; and he sets them down together with lofty praise, saying, "Which is Christ in you?" But if He be in you, why seek ye Angels? "Of this mystery".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:43
verses.text: For there are other mysteries besides.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:44
verses.text: But this is really a mystery, which no one knew, which is marvelous, which is beside the common expectation, which was hid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:45
verses.text: "Which is Christ in you," he saith, "the hope of glory, whom we proclaim," bringing Him from above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:46
verses.text: "Whom we," not Angels: "teaching" and "admonishing": not imperiously nor using constraint, for this too is of God's lovingkindness to men, not to bring them to Him after the manner of a tyrant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:47
verses.text: Seeing it was a great thing he had said, "teaching," he added, "admonishing," which is rather like a father than an instructor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:48
verses.text: "Whom," saith he, "we proclaim, admonishing every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:49
verses.text: So that all wisdom is needed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:50
verses.text: That is, saying all things in wisdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:51
verses.text: For the ability to learn such things exists not in every one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:52
verses.text: "That we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:53
verses.text: What sayest thou, "every man"? Yea; this is what we are earnestly desirous of doing, he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:54
verses.text: For what, if this do not come to pass? the blessed Paul endeavored.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:55
verses.text: "Perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:56
verses.text: This then is perfection, the other is imperfect: so that if one have not even the whole of wisdom, he is imperfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:57
verses.text: "Perfect in Christ Jesus," not in the Law, nor in Angels, for that is not perfection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:58
verses.text: "In Christ," that is, in the knowledge of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:59
verses.text: For he that knows what Christ has done, will have higher thoughts than to be satisfied with Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:60
verses.text: "In Christ Jesus"; Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:61
verses.text: "Whereunto I labor also, striving".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:62
verses.text: And he said not, "I am desirous" merely, nor in any indifferent way, but "I labor, striving," with great earnestness, with much watching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:63
verses.text: If I, for your good, thus watch, much more ought ye.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:64
verses.text: Then again, showing that it is of God, he saith, "according to His working which worketh in me mightily".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:65
verses.text: He shows that this is the work of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:66
verses.text: He, now, that makes me strong for this, evidently wills it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:67
verses.text: Wherefore also when beginning he saith, "Through the will of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:68
verses.text: (Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:69
verses.text: ) So that it is not only out of modesty he so expresses himself, but insisting on the truth of the Word as well.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:70
verses.text: "And striving".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:71
verses.text: In saying this, he shows that many are fighting against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:72
verses.text: Then great is his tender affection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:73
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:74
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:75
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:76
verses.text: "For I would have you know how greatly I strive for you, and for them at Laodicea".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:77
verses.text: Then lest this should seem owing to their peculiar weakness, he joined others also with them, and as yet condemned them not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:78
verses.text: But why does he say, "And as many as have not seen my face in the flesh"? He shows here after a divine manner, that they saw him constantly in the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:79
verses.text: And he bears witness to their great love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:80
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:82
verses.text: "That their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may know the mystery of God the Father, and of Christ: in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:83
verses.text: Now henceforward he is hastening and in pangs to enter upon the doctrine, neither accusing them, nor clearing them of accusation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:84
verses.text: "I strive," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:85
verses.text: To what end? That they may be knit together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:86
verses.text: What he means is something like this; that they may stand firm in the faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:87
verses.text: He doth not however so express himself; but extenuates the matter of accusation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:88
verses.text: That is, that they may be united with love, not with necessity nor with force.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:89
verses.text: For as I have said, he always avoids offending, by leaving it to themselves; and therefore "striving," because I wish it to be with love, and willingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:90
verses.text: For I do not wish it to be with the lips merely, nor merely that they shall be brought together, but "that their hearts may be comforted".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:91
verses.text: "Being knit together in love unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:92
verses.text: That is, that they may doubt about nothing, that they may be fully assured in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:93
verses.text: But I meant full assurance which is by faith, for there is a full assurance which cometh by arguments, but that is worthy of no consideration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:94
verses.text: I know, he saith, that ye believe, but I would have you fully assured: not "unto riches" only, but "unto all riches"; that your full assurance may be intense, as well as in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:95
verses.text: And observe the wisdom of this blessed one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:96
verses.text: He said not, "Ye do ill that ye are not fully assured," nor accused them; but, ye know not how desirous I am that ye may be fully assured, and not merely so, but with understanding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:97
verses.text: For seeing he spoke of faith; suppose not, he saith, that I meant barely and unprofitably, but with understanding and love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:98
verses.text: "That they may know the mystery of God the Father and of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:99
verses.text: So that this is the mystery of God, the being brought unto Him by the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:100
verses.text: "And of Christ, in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:101
verses.text: But if they are in Him, then wisely also no doubt He came at this time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:102
verses.text: Wherefore then do some foolish persons object to Him, "See how He discourseth with the simpler sort".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:103
verses.text: "In whom are all the treasures".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:104
verses.text: He himself knows all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:105
verses.text: "Hid," for think not in truth that ye already have all; they are hidden also even from Angels, not, from you only; so that you ought to ask all things from Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:106
verses.text: He himself giveth wisdom and knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:107
verses.text: Now by saying, "treasures," he shows their largeness, by "All," that He is ignorant of nothing, by "hid," that He alone knoweth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:108
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:109
verses.text: "This I say, that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:110
verses.text: Seest thou that he saith, I have therefore said this, that ye may not seek it from men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:111
verses.text: "Delude you," he saith, "with persuasiveness of speech".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:112
verses.text: For what if any doth speak, and speak persuasively?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:113
verses.text: "For though I am absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:114
verses.text: The direct thing to have said here was, "even though I be absent in the flesh, yet, nevertheless, I know the deceivers"; but instead he has ended with praise, "Joying and beholding your order, and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:115
verses.text: "Your order," he means, your good order.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:116
verses.text: "And the steadfastness of your faith in Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:117
verses.text: This is still more in the way of encomium.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:118
verses.text: And he said not "faith," but steadfastness, as to soldiers standing in good order and firmly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:119
verses.text: Now that which is steadfast, neither deceit nor trial can shake asunder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:120
verses.text: Not only, he saith, have ye not fallen, but no one hath so much as thrown you into disorder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:121
verses.text: He hath set himself over them, that they may fear him as though present; for thus is order preserved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:122
verses.text: From solidity follows compactedness, for you will then produce solidity, when having brought many things together, you shall cement them compactedly and inseparably; thus a solidity is produced, as in the case of a wall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:123
verses.text: But this is the peculiar work of love; for those who were by themselves, when it hath closely cemented and knit them together, it renders solid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:124
verses.text: And faith, again, doeth the same thing; when it allows not reasonings to intrude themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:125
verses.text: For as reasonings divide, and shake loose, so faith causes solidity and compactness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:126
verses.text: For seeing God hath bestowed upon us benefits surpassing man's reasoning, suitably enough He hath brought in faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:127
verses.text: It is not possible to be steadfast, when demanding reasons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:128
verses.text: For behold all our lofty doctrines, how destitute they are of reasonings, and dependent upon faith alone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:129
verses.text: God is not anywhere, and is everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:130
verses.text: What hath less reason in it than this? Each by itself is full of difficulty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:131
verses.text: For, indeed, He is not in place; nor is there any place in which He is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:132
verses.text: He was not made, He made not Himself, He never began to be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:133
verses.text: What reasoning will receive this, if there be not faith? Does it not seem to be utterly ridiculous, and more endless than a riddle?  Now that He hath no beginning, and is uncreate, and uncircumscribed, and infinite, is, as we have said, a manifest difficulty; but let us consider His incorporealness, whether we can search out this by reasoning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:134
verses.text: God is incorporeal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:135
verses.text: What is incorporeal? A bare word, and no more, for the apprehension has received nothing, has impressed nothing upon itself; for if it does so impress, it comes to nature, and what constitutes body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:136
verses.text: So that the mouth speaks indeed, but the understanding knows not what it speaks, save one thing only, that it is not body, this is all it knows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:137
verses.text: And why do I speak of God? In the case of the soul, which is created, inclosed, circumscribed, what is incorporealness? say! show! Thou canst not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:138
verses.text: Is it air? But air is body, even though it be not compact, and it is plain from many proofs that it is a yielding body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:139
verses.text: Fire is body, whilst the energy of the soul is bodiless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:140
verses.text: Wherefore? Since it penetrateth everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:141
verses.text: If it is not itself body, then that which is incorporeal exists in place, therefore it is circumscribed; and that which is circumscribed has figure; and figures are linear, and lines belong to bodies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:142
verses.text: Again, that which is without figure, what conception does it admit? It has no figure, no form, no outline.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:143
verses.text: Seest thou how the understanding becomes dizzy?  Again, That Nature viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:144
verses.text: God's is not susceptible of evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:145
verses.text: But He is also good of His own will; it is therefore susceptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:146
verses.text: But one may not so say, far be it! Again, was He brought into being, willing it, or not willing it? But neither may one say this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:147
verses.text: Again, circumscribes He the world, or no? If He circumscribes it not, He is Himself circumscribed, but if He circumscribes it, He is infinite in His nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:148
verses.text: Again, circumscribes He Himself? If He circumscribes Himself, then He is not without beginning to Himself, but to us; therefore He is not in His nature without beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:149
verses.text: Everywhere one must grant contradictories.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:150
verses.text: Seest thou how great the darkness is; and how everywhere there is need of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:151
verses.text: This it is, that is solid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:152
verses.text: But, if you will, let us come to things which are less than these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:153
verses.text: That substance hath an operation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:154
verses.text: And what in His case is operation? Is it a certain motion? Then He is not immutable: for that which is moved, is not immutable: for, from being motionless it becomes in motion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:155
verses.text: But nevertheless He is in motion, and never stands still.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:156
verses.text: But what kind of motion, tell me; for amongst us there are seven kinds; down, up, in, out, right, left, circular, or, if not this, increase, decrease, generation, destruction, alteration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:157
verses.text: But is His motion none of these, but such as the mind is moved with? No, nor this either.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:158
verses.text: Far be it! for in many things the mind is even absurdly moved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:159
verses.text: Is to will, to operate, or not? If to will is to operate, and He wills all men to be good, and to be saved ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:160
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:161
verses.text: ), how comes it not to pass? But to will is one thing, to operate, another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:162
verses.text: To will then is not sufficient for operation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:163
verses.text: How then saith the Scripture, "He hath done whatsoever He willed"? (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:164
verses.text: cxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:165
verses.text: ) And again, the leper saith unto Christ, "If Thou wilt, Thou canst make me clean".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:166
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:167
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:168
verses.text: ) For if this follows in company with the will, what is to be said? Will ye that I mention yet another thing? How were the things that are, made out of things that are not? How will they be resolved into nothing? What is above the heaven? And again, what above that? and what above that? and beyond that? and so on to infinity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:169
verses.text: What is below the earth? Sea, and beyond this, what? and beyond that again? Nay; to the right, and to the left, is there not the same difficulty?  But these indeed are things unseen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:170
verses.text: Will ye that I lead the discourse to those which are seen; those which have already happened? Tell me, how did the beast contain Jonah in its belly, without his perishing? Is it not void of reason, and its motions without control? How spared it the righteous man? How was it that the heat did not suffocate him? How was it that it putrefied him not? For if to be in the deep only, is past contriving, to be both in the creature's bowels, and in that heat, is very far more unaccountable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:171
verses.text: If from within we breathe the air, how did the respiration suffice for two animals? And how did it also vomit him forth unharmed? And how too did he speak? And how too was he self-possessed, and prayed? Are not these things incredible? If we test them by reasonings, they are incredible, if by faith, they are exceeding credible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:172
verses.text: Shall I say something more than this? The wheat in the earth's bosom decays, and rises again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:173
verses.text: Behold marvels, opposite, and each surpassing the other; marvelous is the not becoming corrupted, marvelous, after becoming so, is the rising again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:174
verses.text: Where are they that make sport of such things, and disbelieve the Resurrection and say, This bone how shall it be cemented to that? and introduce such like silly tales.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:175
verses.text: Tell me, how did Elias ascend in a chariot of fire? Fire is wont to burn, not to carry aloft.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:176
verses.text: How lives he so long a time? In what place is he? Why was this done? Whither was Enoch translated? Lives he on like food with us? and what is it hinders him from being here? Nay, but does he not eat? And wherefore was he translated? Behold how God schooleth us by little and little.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:177
verses.text: He translated Enoch; no very great thing that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:178
verses.text: This instructed us for the taking up of Elias.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:179
verses.text: He shut in Noe into the ark (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:180
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:181
verses.text: ); nor is this either any very great thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:182
verses.text: This instructed us for the shutting up of the prophet within the whale.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:183
verses.text: Thus even the things of old stood in need of forerunners and types.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:184
verses.text: For as in a ladder the first step sends on to the second, and from the first it is not possible to step to the fourth, and this sends one on to that, that that may be the way to the next; and as it is not possible either to get to the second before the first; so also is it here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:185
verses.text: And observe the signs of signs, and thou wilt discern this in the ladder which Jacob saw.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:186
verses.text: "Above," it is said, "the Lord stood fast, and underneath Angels were ascending and descending".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:187
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:188
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:189
verses.text: ) It was prophesied that the Father hath a Son; it was necessary this should be believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:190
verses.text: Whence wouldest thou that I show thee the signs of this? From above, downward? From beneath, upward? Because He begetteth without passion, for this reason did she that was barren first bear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:191
verses.text: Let us rather go higher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:192
verses.text: It was necessary to be believed, that He begat of Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:193
verses.text: What then? The thing happens obscurely indeed, as in type and shadow, but still it doth happen, and as it goes on it becomes somehow clearer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:194
verses.text: A woman is formed out of man alone, and he remains whole and entire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:195
verses.text: Again, it was necessary there should be some sure sign of the Conception of a Virgin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:196
verses.text: So the barren beareth, not once only, but a second time and a third, and many times.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:197
verses.text: Of His birth then of a Virgin, the barren is a type, and she sends the mind forward to faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:198
verses.text: Again, this was a type of God being able to beget alone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:199
verses.text: For if man is the chief agent, and birth takes place without him, in a more excellent way, much rather, is One begotten of the Chiefest Agent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:200
verses.text: There is still another generation, which is a type of the Truth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:201
verses.text: I mean, ours by the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:202
verses.text: Of this again the barren a type, the fact that it is not of blood (John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:203
verses.text: ); this pertains to the generation above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:204
verses.text: The one—as also the types—shows that the generation is to be without passion; the other, that it could proceed from one above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:205
verses.text: Christ is above, ruling over all things: it was necessary this should be believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:206
verses.text: The same takes place in the earth with respect to man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:207
verses.text: "Let Us make man after Our image and likeness" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:208
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:209
verses.text: ), for dominion of all the brutes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:210
verses.text: Thus He instructed us, not by words, but by actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:211
verses.text: Paradise showed the separateness of his nature, and that man was the best thing of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:212
verses.text: Christ was to rise again; see now how many sure signs there were; Enoch, Elias, Jonas, the fiery furnace, the case of Noah, baptism, the seeds, the plants, our own generation, that of all animals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:213
verses.text: For since on this everything was at stake, it, more than any other, had abundance of types.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:214
verses.text: That the Universe is not without a Providence we may conjecture from things amongst ourselves, for nothing will continue to exist, if not provided for; but even herds, and all other things stand in need of governance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:215
verses.text: And that the Universe was not made by chance, Hell is a proof, and so was the deluge in Noah's day, the fire, the overwhelming of the Egyptians in the sea, the things which happened in the wilderness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:216
verses.text: It was necessary too that many things should prepare the way for Baptism; yea, thousands of things; those, for instance, in the Old Testament, those in the Pool, the cleansing of him that was not sound in health, the deluge itself, and all the things that have been done in water, the baptism of John.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:217
verses.text: It was necessary to be believed that God giveth up His Son; a man did this by anticipation, Abraham the Patriarch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:218
verses.text: Types then of all these things, if we are so inclined, we shall find by searching in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:219
verses.text: But let us not be weary, but attune ourselves by these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 6:220
verses.text: Let us hold the faith steadfastly, and show forth strictness of life: that having through all things returned thanks to God, we may be counted worthy of the good things promised to them that love Him, through the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:1
verses.text: Homily VI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:2
verses.text: Colossians ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:3
verses.text: ,  "As therefore ye received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him, rooted and built up in Him, and stablished in your faith, even as ye were taught, abounding in thanksgiving".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:4
verses.text: Again, he takes hold on them beforehand with their own testimony, saying, "As therefore ye received".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:5
verses.text: We introduce no strange addition, he saith, neither do ye.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:6
verses.text: "Walk ye in Him," for He is the Way that leadeth to the Father: not in the Angels; this way leadeth not thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:7
verses.text: "Rooted," that is, fixed; not one while going this way, another that, but "rooted": now that which is rooted, never can remove.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:8
verses.text: Observe how appropriate are the expressions he employs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:9
verses.text: "And built up," that is, in thought attaining unto Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:10
verses.text: "And stablished" in Him, that is, holding Him, built as on a foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:11
verses.text: He shows that they had fallen down, for the word "built" has this force.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:12
verses.text: For the faith is in truth a building; and needs both a strong foundation, and secure construction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:13
verses.text: For both if any one build not upon a secure foundation it will shake; and even though he do, if it be not firm, it will not stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:14
verses.text: "As ye were taught".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:15
verses.text: Again, the word "As".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:16
verses.text: "Abounding," he saith, "in thanksgiving"; for this is the part of well-disposed persons, I say not simply to give thanks, but with great abundance, more than ye learned, if possible, with much ambition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:17
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:18
verses.text: "Take heed lest there shall be any one that maketh spoil of you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:19
verses.text: Seest thou how he shows him to be a thief, and an alien, and one that enters in softly? For he has already represented him to be entering in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:20
verses.text: "Beware".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:21
verses.text: And he well said "maketh spoil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:22
verses.text: As one digging away a mound from underneath, may give no perceptible sign, yet it gradually settles, so do you also beware; for this is his main point, not even to let himself be perceived.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:23
verses.text: As if some one were robbing every day, and he (the owner of the house) were told, "Beware lest there be some one"; and he shows the way—through this way—as if we were to say, through this chamber; so, "through philosophy," says he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:24
verses.text: Then because the term "philosophy" has an appearance of dignity, he added, "and vain deceit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:25
verses.text: For there is also a good deceit; such as many have been deceived by, which one ought not even to call a deceit at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:26
verses.text: Whereof Jeremiah speaks; "O Lord, Thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived" (Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:27
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:28
verses.text: ); for such as this one ought not to call a deceit at all; for Jacob also deceived his father, but that was not a deceit, but an economy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:29
verses.text: "Through his philosophy," he saith, "and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:30
verses.text: Now he sets about to reprove their observance of particular days, meaning by elements of the world the sun and moon; as he also said in the Epistle to the Galatians, "How turn ye back again to the weak and beggarly elements?" (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:31
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:32
verses.text: ) And he said not observances of days, but in general of the present world, to show its worthlessness: for if the present world be nothing, much more then its elements.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:33
verses.text: Having first shown how great benefits and kindnesses they had received, he afterwards brings on his accusation, thereby to show its greater seriousness, and to convict his hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:34
verses.text: Thus too the Prophets do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:35
verses.text: They always first point out the benefits, and then they magnify their accusation; as Esaias saith, "I have begotten children, and exalted them, but they have rejected me" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:36
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:37
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:38
verses.text: ); and again, "O my people, what have I done unto thee, or wherein have I grieved thee, or wherein have I wearied thee"? (Mic.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:39
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:40
verses.text: ) and David; as when he says, "I heard thee in the secret place of the tempest" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:41
verses.text: lxxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:42
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:43
verses.text: ); and again, "Open thy mouth, and I will fill it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:44
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:45
verses.text: lxxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:46
verses.text: ) And everywhere you will find it the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:47
verses.text: That indeed were most one's duty, not to be persuaded by them, even did they say aught to the purpose; as it is, however, obligations apart even, it would be our duty to shun those things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:48
verses.text: "And not after Christ," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:49
verses.text: For were it in such sort a matter done by halves, that ye were able to serve both the one and the other, not even so ought ye to do it; as it is, however, he suffers you not to be "after Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:50
verses.text: Those things withdraw you from Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:51
verses.text: Having first shaken to pieces the Grecian observances, he next overthrows the Jewish ones also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:52
verses.text: For both Greeks and Jews practiced many observances, but the former from philosophy, the latter from the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:53
verses.text: First then, he makes at those against whom lay the heavier accusation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:54
verses.text: How, "not after Christ"?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:56
verses.text: "For in Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily: and in Him ye are made full, who is the head of all principality and power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:57
verses.text: Observe how in his accusing of the one he thrusts through the other, by first giving the solution, and then the objection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:58
verses.text: For such a solution is not suspected, and the hearer accepts it the rather, that the speaker is not making it his aim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:59
verses.text: For in that case indeed he would make a point of not coming off worsted, but in this, not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:60
verses.text: "For in Him dwelleth," that is, for God dwelleth in Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:61
verses.text: But that thou mayest not think Him enclosed, as in a body, he saith, "All the fullness of the Godhead bodily: and ye are made full in Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:62
verses.text: Others say that he intends the Church filled by His Godhead, as he elsewhere saith, "of Him that filleth all in all" (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:63
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:64
verses.text: ), and that the term "bodily" is here, as the body in the head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:65
verses.text: How is it then that he did not add, "which is the Church"? Some again say it is with reference to The Father, that he says that the fullness of the Godhead dwells in Him, but wrongly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:66
verses.text: First, because "to dwell," cannot strictly be said of God: next, because the "fullness" is not that which receives, for "the earth is the Lord's, and the fullness thereof" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:67
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:68
verses.text: ); and again the Apostle, "until the fullness of the Gentiles be come in".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:69
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:70
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:71
verses.text: ) By "fullness" is meant "the whole".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:72
verses.text: Then the word "bodily," what did it intend? "As in a head".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:73
verses.text: But why does he say the same thing over again? "And ye are made full in Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:74
verses.text: What then does it mean? That ye have nothing less than He.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:75
verses.text: As it dwelt in Him, so also in you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:76
verses.text: For Paul is ever straining to bring us near to Christ; as when he says, "Hath raised us up with Him, and made us to sit with Him" (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:77
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:78
verses.text: ): and, "If we endure, we shall also reign with Him" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:79
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:80
verses.text: ): and, "How shall He not also with Him freely give us all things" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:81
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:82
verses.text: ): and calling us "fellow-heirs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:83
verses.text: Then as for His dignity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:84
verses.text: And He "is the head of all principality and power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:85
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:86
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:87
verses.text: ) He that is above all, The Cause, is He not Consubstantial? Then he has added the benefit in a marvelous way; and far more marvelous than in the Epistle to the Romans.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:88
verses.text: For there indeed he saith, "circumcision of the heart in the spirit, not in the letter" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:89
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:90
verses.text: ), but here, in Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:91
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:92
verses.text: "In whom ye were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, in the putting off of the body of the flesh in the circumcision of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:93
verses.text: See how near he is come to the thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:94
verses.text: He saith, "In the putting" quite away, not putting off merely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:95
verses.text: "The body of sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:96
verses.text: He means, "the old life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:97
verses.text: He is continually adverting to this in different ways, as he said above, "Who delivered us out of the power of darkness, and reconciled us who were alienated," that we should be "holy and without blemish".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:98
verses.text: (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:99
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:101
verses.text: ) No longer, he saith, is the circumcision with the knife, but in Christ Himself; for no hand imparts this circumcision, as is the case there, but the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:102
verses.text: It circumciseth not a part, but the whole man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:103
verses.text: It is the body both in the one and the other case, but in the one it is carnally, in the other it is spiritually circumcised; but not as the Jews, for ye have not put off flesh, but sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:104
verses.text: When and where? In Baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:105
verses.text: And what he calls circumcision, he again calls burial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:106
verses.text: Observe how he again passes on to the subject of righteous doings; "of the sins," he saith, "of the flesh," the things they had done in the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:107
verses.text: He speaks of a greater thing than circumcision, for they did not merely cast away that of which they were circumcised, but they destroyed it, they annihilated it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:108
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:109
verses.text: "Buried with him," he saith, "in Baptism, wherein ye were also raised with Him, through faith in the working of God, who raised Him from the dead".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:110
verses.text: But it is not burial only: for behold what he says, "Wherein ye were also raised with Him, through faith in the working of God, who raised Him from the dead".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:111
verses.text: He hath well said, "of faith," for it is all of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:112
verses.text: Ye believed that God is able to raise, and so ye were raised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:113
verses.text: Then note also His worthiness of belief, "Who raised Him," he saith, "from the dead".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:114
verses.text: He now shows the Resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:115
verses.text: "And you who sometime were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, you, I say, did He quicken together with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:116
verses.text: For ye lay under judgment of death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:117
verses.text: But even though ye died, it was a profitable death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:118
verses.text: Observe how again he shows what they deserved in the words he subjoins:  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:120
verses.text: "Having forgiven us all our trespasses; having blotted out the bond written in ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us: and he hath taken it out of the way, nailing it to the Cross; having put off from himself the principalities and the powers, He made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:121
verses.text: "Having forgiven us," he saith, "all our trespasses," those which produced that deadness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:122
verses.text: What then? Did He allow them to remain? No, He even wiped them out; He did not scratch them out merely; so that they could not be seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:123
verses.text: "In doctrines" ordinances, he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:124
verses.text: What doctrines? The Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:125
verses.text: It is enough to believe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:126
verses.text: He hath not set works against works, but works against faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:127
verses.text: And what next? Blotting out is an advance upon remission; again he saith, "And hath taken it out of the way".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:128
verses.text: Nor yet even so did He preserve it, but rent it even in sunder, "by nailing it to His Cross".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:129
verses.text: "Having put off from himself the principalities and the powers, He made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:130
verses.text: Nowhere has he spoken in so lofty a strain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:131
verses.text: Seest thou how great His earnestness that the bond should be done away? To wit, we all were under sin and punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:132
verses.text: He Himself, through suffering punishment, did away with both the sin and the punishment, and He was punished on the Cross.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:133
verses.text: To the Cross then He affixed it; as having power, He tore it asunder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:134
verses.text: What bond? He means either that which they said to Moses, namely, "All that God hath said will we do, and be obedient" (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:135
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:136
verses.text: ), or, if not that, this, that we owe to God obedience; or if not this, he means that the devil held possession of it, the bond which God made for Adam, saying, "In the day thou eatest of the tree, thou shalt die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:137
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:138
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:139
verses.text: ) This bond then the devil held in his possession.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:140
verses.text: And Christ did not give it to us, but Himself tore it in two, the action of one who remits joyfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:141
verses.text: "Having put off from himself the principalities and the powers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:142
verses.text: He means the diabolical powers; because human nature had arrayed itself in these, or because they had, as it were, a hold, when He became Man He put away from Himself that hold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:143
verses.text: What is the meaning of "He made a show of them"? And well said he so; never yet was the devil in so shameful a plight.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:144
verses.text: For whilst expecting to have Him, he lost even those he had; and when That Body was nailed to the Cross, the dead arose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:145
verses.text: There death received his wound, having met his death-stroke from a dead body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:146
verses.text: And as an athlete, when he thinks he has hit his adversary, himself is caught in a fatal grasp; so truly doth Christ also show, that to die with confidence is the devil's shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:147
verses.text: For he would have done everything to persuade men that He did not die, had he had the power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:148
verses.text: For seeing that of His Resurrection indeed all succeeding time was proof demonstrative; whilst of His death, no other time save that whereat it happened could ever furnish proof; therefore it was, that He died publicly in the sight of all men, but He arose not publicly, knowing that the aftertime would bear witness to the truth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:149
verses.text: For, that whilst the world was looking on, the serpent should be slain on high upon the Cross, herein is the marvel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:150
verses.text: For what did not the devil do, that He might die in secret? Hear Pilate saying, "Take ye Him away, and crucify Him, for I find no fault in Him" (John xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:151
verses.text: ), and withstanding them in a thousand ways.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:152
verses.text: And again the Jews said unto Him, "If Thou art the Son of God, come down from the Cross".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:153
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:154
verses.text: xxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:155
verses.text: ) Then further, when He had received a mortal wound, and He came not down, for this reason He was also committed to burial; for it was in His power to have risen immediately: but He did not, that the fact might be believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:156
verses.text: And yet in cases of private death indeed, it is possible to impute them to a swoon, but here, it is not possible to do this either.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:157
verses.text: For even the soldiers brake not His legs, like those of the others, that it might be made manifest that He was dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:158
verses.text: And those who buried The Body are known; and therefore too the Jews themselves seal the stone along with the soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:159
verses.text: For, what was most of all attended to, was this very thing, that it should not be in obscurity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:160
verses.text: And the witnesses to it are from enemies, from the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:161
verses.text: Hear them saying to Pilate, "That deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I rise again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:162
verses.text: Command therefore that the sepulchre" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:163
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:165
verses.text: ) be guarded by the soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:166
verses.text: This was accordingly done, themselves also sealing it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:167
verses.text: Hear them further saying even afterwards to the Apostles, "Ye intend to bring this Man's blood upon us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:168
verses.text: (Acts v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:169
verses.text: ) He suffered not the very fashion of His Cross to be put to shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:170
verses.text: For since the Angels have suffered nothing like it, He therefore doth everything for this, showing that His death achieved a mighty work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:171
verses.text: There was, as it were, a single combat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:172
verses.text: Death wounded Christ: but Christ, being wounded, did afterwards kill death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:173
verses.text: He that seemed to be immortal, was destroyed by a mortal body; and this the whole world saw.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:174
verses.text: And what is truly wonderful is, that He committed not this thing to another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:175
verses.text: But there was made again a second bond of another kind than the former.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:176
verses.text: Beware then lest we be condemned by this, after saying, I renounce Satan, and array myself with Thee, O Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:177
verses.text: Rather however this should not be called "a bond," but a covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:178
verses.text: For that is "a bond," whereby one is held accountable for debts: but this is a covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:179
verses.text: It hath no penalty, nor saith it, If this be done or if this be not done: what Moses said when he sprinkled the blood of the covenant, by this God also promised everlasting life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:180
verses.text: All this is a covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:181
verses.text: There, it was slave with master, here it is friend with friend: there, it is said, "In the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt die" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:182
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:183
verses.text: ); an immediate threatening; but here is nothing of the kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:184
verses.text: God arrives, and here is nakedness, and there was nakedness; there, however, one that had sinned was made naked, because he sinned, but here, one is made naked, that he may be set free.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:185
verses.text: Then, man put off the glory which he had; now, he puts off the old man; and before going up (to the contest), puts him off as easily, as it were his garments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:186
verses.text: He is anointed, as wrestlers about to enter the lists.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:187
verses.text: For he is born at once; and as that first man was, not by little and little, but immediately.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:188
verses.text: (He is anointed,) not as the priests of old time, on the head alone, but rather in more abundant measure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:189
verses.text: For he indeed was anointed on the head, the right ear, the hand (Lev.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:190
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:192
verses.text: ); to excite him to obedience, and to good works; but this one, all over.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:193
verses.text: For he cometh not to be instructed merely; but to wrestle, and to be exercised; he is advanced to another creation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:194
verses.text: For when one confesses (his belief) in the life everlasting, he has confessed a second creation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:195
verses.text: He took dust from the earth, and formed man (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:196
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:197
verses.text: ): but now, dust no longer, but the Holy Spirit; with This he is formed, with this harmonized, even as Himself was in the womb of the Virgin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:198
verses.text: He said not in Paradise, but "in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:199
verses.text: For deem not that, because the subject is earth, it is done on earth; he is removed thither, to Heaven, there these things are transacted, in the midst of Angels: God taketh up thy soul above, above He harmonizeth it anew, He placeth thee near to the Kingly Throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:200
verses.text: He is formed in the water, he receiveth spirit instead of a soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:201
verses.text: And after he is formed, He bringeth to him, not beasts, but demons, and their prince, and saith, "Tread upon serpents and scorpions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:202
verses.text: (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:203
verses.text: ) He saith not, "Let Us make man in our image, and after our likeness" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:204
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:205
verses.text: ), but what? "He giveth them to become the sons of God; but of God," he saith, "they were born".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:206
verses.text: (John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:208
verses.text: ) Then that thou give no ear to the serpent, straightway he teaches thee to say, "I renounce thee," that is, "whatsoever thou sayest, I will not hear thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:209
verses.text: Then, that he destroy thee not by means of others, it is said, "and thy pomp, and thy service, and thy angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:210
verses.text: He hath set him no more to keep Paradise, but to have his citizenship in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:211
verses.text: For straightway when he cometh up he pronounceth these words, "Our Father, Which art in Heaven,…Thy will be done, as in Heaven, so on earth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:212
verses.text: The plain falleth not on thy sight, thou seest not tree, nor fountain, but straightway thou takest into thee the Lord Himself, thou art mingled with His Body, thou art intermixed with that Body that lieth above, whither the devil cannot approach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:213
verses.text: No woman is there, for him to approach, and deceive as the weaker; for it is said, "There is neither female, nor male".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:214
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:215
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:216
verses.text: ) If thou go not down to him, he will not have power to come up where thou art; for thou art in Heaven, and Heaven is unapproachable by the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:217
verses.text: It hath no tree with knowledge of good and evil, but the Tree of Life only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:218
verses.text: No more shall woman be formed from thy side, but we all are one from the side of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:219
verses.text: For if they who have been anointed of men take no harm by serpents, neither wilt thou take any harm at all, so long as thou art anointed; that thou mayst be able to grasp the Serpent and choke him, "to tread upon serpents and scorpions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:220
verses.text: (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:221
verses.text: ) But as the gifts are great, so is the punishment great also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:222
verses.text: It is not possible for him that hath fallen from Paradise, to dwell "in front of Paradise" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:223
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:224
verses.text: ), nor to reascend thither from whence we have fallen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:225
verses.text: But what after this? Hell, and the worm undying.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:226
verses.text: But far be it that any of us should become amenable to this punishment! but living virtuously, let us earnestly strive to do throughout His will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 7:227
verses.text: Let us become well-pleasing to God, that we may be able both to escape the punishment, and to obtain the good things eternal, of which may we all be counted worthy, through the grace and love toward man, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:1
verses.text: Homily VII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:2
verses.text: Colossians ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:3
verses.text: –  "Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of a feast day, or a new moon, or a sabbath day: which are a shadow of the things to come; but the body is Christ's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:4
verses.text: Let no man rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshiping of the Angels, dwelling in the things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind, and not holding fast the Head, from whom all the body being supplied and knit together, through the joints and bands, increaseth with the increase of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:5
verses.text: Having first said darkly, "Take heed lest there shall be any one that maketh spoil of you after the tradition of men" (ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:6
verses.text: ); and again, further back, "This, I say, that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech" (ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:7
verses.text: ); thus preoccupying their soul, and working in it anxious thoughts; next, having inserted those benefits, and increased this effect, he then brings in his reproof last, and says, "Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of a feast day, or a new moon, or a sabbath day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:8
verses.text: Seest thou how he depreciates them? If ye have obtained such things, he saith, why make yourselves accountable for these petty matters? And he makes light of them, saying, "or in the part of a feast day," for in truth they did not retain the whole of the former rule, "or a new moon, or a sabbath day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:9
verses.text: He said not, "Do not then observe them," but, "let no man judge you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:10
verses.text: He showed that they were transgressing, and undoing, but he brought his charge against others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:11
verses.text: Endure not those that judge you, he saith, nay, not so much as this either, but he argues with those persons, almost stopping their mouths, and saying, Ye ought not to judge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:12
verses.text: But he would not have reflected on these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:13
verses.text: He said not "in clean and unclean," nor yet "in feasts of Tabernacles, and unleavened bread, and Pentecost," but "in part of a feast": for they ventured not to keep the whole; and if they did observe it, yet not so as to celebrate the feast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:14
verses.text: "In part," he saith, showing that the greater part is done away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:15
verses.text: For even if they did keep sabbath, they did not do so with precision.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:16
verses.text: "Which are a shadow of the things to come"; he means, of the New Covenant; "but the body" is "Christ's".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:17
verses.text: Some persons here punctuate thus, "but the body" is "of Christ," i-e: the truth is come in with Christ: others thus; "The Body of Christ let no man adjudge away from you," that is, thwart you of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:18
verses.text: The term καταβραβευθῆναι, is employed when the victory is with one party, and the prize with another, when though a victor thou art thwarted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:19
verses.text: Thou standest above the devil and sin; why dost thou again subject thyself to sin? Therefore he said that "he is a debtor to fulfill the whole law" (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:20
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:21
verses.text: ); and again, "Is Christ" found to be "the minister of sin" (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:22
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:23
verses.text: )? which he said when writing to the Galatians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:24
verses.text: When he had filled them with anger through saying, "adjudge away from you," then he begins; "being a voluntary," he saith, "in humility and worshiping of Angels, intruding into things he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:25
verses.text: How "in humility," or how "puffed up"? He shows that the whole arose out of vainglory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:26
verses.text: But what is on the whole the drift of what is said? There are some who maintain that we must be brought near by Angels, not by Christ, that were too great a thing for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:27
verses.text: Therefore it is that he turns over and over again what has been done by Christ, "through the Blood of His Cross" (c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:28
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:29
verses.text: ); on this account he says that "He suffered for us"; that "He loved us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:30
verses.text: ( Pet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:31
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:32
verses.text: ) And besides in this very same thing, moreover, they were elevated afresh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:33
verses.text: And he said not "introduction by," but "worshiping of" Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:34
verses.text: "Intruding into things he hath not seen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:35
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:36
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:37
verses.text: ) For he hath not seen Angels, and yet is affected as though he had.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:38
verses.text: Therefore he saith, "Puffed up by his fleshly mind vainly," not about any true fact.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:39
verses.text: About this doctrine, he is puffed up, and puts forward a show of humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:40
verses.text: By his carnal mind, not spiritual; his reasoning is of man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:41
verses.text: "And not holding fast the Head," he saith, "from whom all the body".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:42
verses.text: All the body thence hath its being, and its well-being.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:43
verses.text: Why, letting go the Head, dost thou cling to the members? If thou art fallen off from it, thou art lost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:44
verses.text: "From whom all the body".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:45
verses.text: Every one, be he who he may, thence has not life only, but also even connection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:46
verses.text: All the Church, so long as she holds The Head, increaseth; because here is no more passion of pride and vainglory, nor invention of human fancy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:47
verses.text: Mark that "from whom," meaning the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:48
verses.text: "Through the joints and bands," he says, "being supplied, and knit together, increases with the increase of God"; he means, that which is according to God, that of the best life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:49
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:50
verses.text: "If ye died with Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:51
verses.text: He puts that in the middle, and on either side, expressions of greater vehemence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:52
verses.text: "If ye died with Christ from the elements of the world," he saith, "why as though living in the world do ye subject yourselves to ordinances?" This is not the consequence, for what ought to have been said is, "how as though living are ye subject to those elements?" But letting this pass, what saith he?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:54
verses.text: "Handle not, nor taste, nor touch; all which things are to perish with the using; after the precepts and doctrines of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:55
verses.text: Ye are not in the world, he saith, how is it ye are subject to its elements? how to its observances? And mark how he makes sport of them, "touch not, handle not, taste not," as though they were cowards and keeping themselves clear of some great matters, "all which things are to perish with the using".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:56
verses.text: He has taken down the swollenness of the many, and added, "after the precepts and doctrines of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:57
verses.text: What sayest thou? Dost thou speak even of the Law? Henceforth it is but a doctrine of men, after the time is come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 8:58
