verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:22
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:23
verses.text: ); and again, "My wounds stink and are corrupt from the face of my foolishness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:24
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:25
verses.text: xxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:26
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:27
verses.text: ) For what is more foolish, tell me, than one who indeed wrappeth himself about in his own garments, but regardeth not his brethren that are naked; who feedeth dogs, and careth not that the image of God is famishing; who is merely persuaded that human things are nought, and yet clings to them as if immortal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:28
verses.text: As then nothing is more foolish than such an one, so is nothing wiser than one that achieveth virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:29
verses.text: For mark; how wise he is, says one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:30
verses.text: He imparteth of his substance, he is pitiful, he is loving to men, he hath well considered that he beareth a common nature with them; he hath well considered the use of wealth, that it is worthy of no estimation; that one ought to be sparing of bodies that are of kin to one, rather than of wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:31
verses.text: He that is a despiser of glory is wholly wise, for he knoweth human affairs; the knowledge of things divine and human, is philosophy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:32
verses.text: So then he knoweth what things are divine, and what are human, and from the one he keeps himself, on the other he bestoweth his pains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:33
verses.text: And he knows how to give thanks also to God in all things, he considers the present life as nothing; therefore he is neither delighted with prosperity, nor grieved with the opposite condition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:34
verses.text: Tarry not, I entreat, for another to teach thee; thou hast the oracles of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:35
verses.text: No man teacheth thee as they; for he indeed oft grudgeth much for vainglory's sake and envy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:36
verses.text: Hearken, I entreat you, all ye that are careful for this life, and procure books that will be medicines for the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:37
verses.text: If ye will not any other, yet get you at least the New Testament, the Apostolic Epistles, the Acts, the Gospels, for your constant teachers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:38
verses.text: If grief befall thee, dive into them as into a chest of medicines; take thence comfort of thy trouble, be it loss, or death, or bereavement of relations; or rather dive not into them merely, but take them wholly to thee; keep them in thy mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:39
verses.text: This is the cause of all evils, the not knowing the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:40
verses.text: We go into battle without arms, and how ought we to come off safe? Well contented should we be if we can be safe with them, let alone without them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:41
verses.text: Throw not the whole upon us! Sheep ye are, still not without reason, but rational; Paul committeth much to you also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:42
verses.text: They that are under instruction, are not for ever learning; for then they are not taught.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:43
verses.text: If thou art for ever learning, thou wilt never learn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:44
verses.text: Do not so come as meaning to be always learning; (for so thou wilt never know;) but so as to finish learning, and to teach others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:45
verses.text: In the arts do not all persons continue for set times, in the sciences, and in a word, in all the arts? Thus we all fix definitely a certain known time; but if ye are ever learning, it is a certain proof that ye have learned nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:46
verses.text: This reproach God spake against the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:47
verses.text: "Borne from the belly, and instructed even to old age".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:48
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:49
verses.text: xlvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:50
verses.text: , , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:51
verses.text: ) If ye had not always been expecting this, all things would not have gone backward in this way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:52
verses.text: Had it been so, that some had finished learning, and others were about to have finished, our work would have been forward; ye would both have given place to others, and would have helped us as well.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:53
verses.text: Tell me, were some to go to a grammarian and continue always learning their letters, would they not give their teacher much trouble? How long shall I have to discourse to you concerning life? In the Apostles' times it was not thus, but they continually leaped from place to place, appointing those who first learned to be the teachers of any others that were under instruction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:54
verses.text: Thus they were enabled to circle the world, through not being bound to one place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:55
verses.text: How much instruction, think ye, do your brethren in the country stand in need of, they and their teachers? But ye hold me riveted fast here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:56
verses.text: For, before the head is set right, it is superfluous to proceed to the rest of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:57
verses.text: Ye throw everything upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:58
verses.text: Ye alone ought to learn from us, and your wives from you, your children from you; but ye leave all to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:59
verses.text: Therefore our toil is excessive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:60
verses.text: "Teaching," he saith, "and admonishing one another with psalms and hymns and spiritual songs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:61
verses.text: Mark also the considerateness of Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:62
verses.text: Seeing that reading is toilsome, and its irksomeness great, he led them not to histories, but to psalms, that thou mightest at once delight thy soul with singing, and gently beguile thy labors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:63
verses.text: "Hymns," he saith, "and spiritual songs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:64
verses.text: But now your children will utter songs and dances of Satan, like cooks, and caterers, and musicians; no one knoweth any psalm, but it seems a thing to be ashamed of even, and a mockery, and a joke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:65
verses.text: There is the treasury house of all these evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:66
verses.text: For whatsoever soil the plant stands in, such is the fruit it bears; if in a sandy and salty soil, of like nature is its fruit; if in a sweet and rich one, it is again similar.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:67
verses.text: So the matter of instruction is a sort of fountain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:68
verses.text: Teach him to sing those psalms which are so full of the love of wisdom; as at once concerning chastity, or rather, before all, of not companying with the wicked, immediately with the very beginning of the book; (for therefore also it was that the prophet began on this wise, "Blessed is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly"; (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:69
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:70
verses.text: ), and again, "I have not sat in the council of vanity"; (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:71
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:72
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:73
verses.text: ), and again, "in his sight a wicked doer is contemned, but he honoreth those that fear the Lord," (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:74
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:75
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:76
verses.text: ,) of companying with the good, (and these subjects thou wilt find there in abundance,) of restraining the belly, of restraining the hand, of refraining from excess, of not overreaching; that money is nothing, nor glory, and other things such like.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:77
verses.text: When in these thou hast led him on from childhood, by little and little thou wilt lead him forward even to the higher things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:78
verses.text: The Psalms contain all things, but the Hymns again have nothing human.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:79
verses.text: When he has been instructed out of the Psalms, he will then know hymns also, as a diviner thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:80
verses.text: For the Powers above chant hymns, not psalms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:81
verses.text: For "a hymn," saith one, "is not comely in the mouth of a sinner" (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:82
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:83
verses.text: ); and again, "Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they sit together with me" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:84
verses.text: ci.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:85
verses.text: , , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:86
verses.text: ); and again, "he that worketh haughtiness hath not dwelt in the midst of my house"; and again, "He that walketh in a blameless way, he ministered unto me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:87
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:88
verses.text: ci.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:89
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:90
verses.text: )  So that ye should safely guard them from intermixing themselves, not only with friends, but even with servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:91
verses.text: For the harm done to the free is incalculable, when we place over them corrupt slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:92
verses.text: For if when enjoying all the benefit of a father's affection and wisdom, they can with difficulty be preserved safe throughout; when we hand them over to the unscrupulousness of servants, they use them like enemies, thinking that they will prove milder masters to them, when they have made them perfect fools, and weak, and worthy of no respect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:93
verses.text: More then than all other things together, let us attend seriously to this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:94
verses.text: "I have loved," saith he," those that love thy law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:95
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:96
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:97
verses.text: , not exact.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:98
verses.text: ) This man then let us too emulate, and such let us love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:99
verses.text: And that the young may further be taught chastity, let them hear the Prophet, saying, "My loins are filled with illusions" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:100
verses.text: xxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:101
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:102
verses.text: ); and again let them hear him saying, "Thou wilt utterly destroy every one that goeth a whoring from Thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:103
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:104
verses.text: lxxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:105
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:106
verses.text: ) And, that one ought to restrain the belly, let them hear again, "And slew," he saith, "the more part of them while the meat was yet in their mouths".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:107
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:108
verses.text: lxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:109
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:110
verses.text: ) And that they ought to be above bribes, "If riches become abundant, set not your heart upon them" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:111
verses.text: lxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:112
verses.text: ); and that they ought to keep glory in subjection, "Nor shall his glory descend together after him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:113
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:114
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:115
verses.text: ) And not to envy the wicked, "Be not envious against them that work unrighteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:116
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:117
verses.text: xxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:118
verses.text: ) And to count power as nothing, "I saw the ungodly in exceeding high place, and lifting himself up as the cedars of Libanus, and I passed by, and lo! he was not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:119
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:120
verses.text: xxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:121
verses.text: ) And to count these present things as nothing, "They counted the people happy, that are in such a case; happy are the people, whose helper is the Lord their God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:122
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:123
verses.text: cxliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:124
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:125
verses.text: ) That we do not sin without notice, but that there is a retribution, "for," he saith, "Thou shalt render to every man according to his works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:126
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:127
verses.text: lxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:128
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:129
verses.text: ) But why doth he not so requite them day by day? "God is a judge," he says, "righteous, and strong, and longsuffering".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:130
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:131
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:132
verses.text: ) That lowliness of mind is good, "Lord," he saith, "my heart is not lifted up" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:133
verses.text: cxxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:134
verses.text: ): that pride is evil, "Therefore," he said, "pride took hold on them wholly" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:135
verses.text: lxxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:136
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:137
verses.text: ); and again, "The Lord resisteth the proud"; and again, "Their injustice shall come out as of fatness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:138
verses.text: That almsgiving is good, "He hath dispersed, he hath given to the needy, his righteousness endureth for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:139
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:140
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:141
verses.text: ) And that to pity is praiseworthy, "He is a good man that pitieth, and lendeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:142
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:143
verses.text: lxxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:144
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:145
verses.text: ) And thou wilt find there many more doctrines than these, full of true philosophy; such as, that one ought not to speak evil, "Him that privily slandereth his neighbor, him did I chase from me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:146
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:147
verses.text: cxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:148
verses.text: )  What is the hymn of those above? The Faithful know.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:149
verses.text: What say the cherubim above? What say the Angels? "Glory to God in the highest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:150
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:151
verses.text: cxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:152
verses.text: ) Therefore after the psalmody come the hymns, as a thing of more perfection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:153
verses.text: "With psalms," he saith, "with hymns, with spiritual songs, with grace singing in your hearts to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:154
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:155
verses.text: ci.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:156
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:157
verses.text: ) He means either this, that God because of grace hath given us these things; or, with the songs in grace; or, admonishing and teaching one another in grace; or, that they had these gifts in grace; or, it is an epexegesis and he means, from the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:158
verses.text: "Singing in your hearts to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:159
verses.text: Not simply with the mouth, he means, but with heedfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:160
verses.text: For this is to "sing to God," but that to the air, for the voice is scattered without result.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:161
verses.text: Not for display, he means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:162
verses.text: And even if thou be in the market-place, thou canst collect thyself, and sing unto God, no one hearing thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:163
verses.text: For Moses also in this way prayed, and was heard, for He saith, "Why criest thou unto Me?" (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:164
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:165
verses.text: ) albeit he said nothing, but cried in thought—wherefore also God alone heard him—with a contrite heart.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:166
verses.text: For it is not forbidden one even when walking to pray in his heart, and to dwell above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:167
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:168
verses.text: "And whatsoever ye do," he saith, "in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:169
verses.text: For if we thus do, there will be nothing polluted, nothing unclean, wherever Christ is called on.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:170
verses.text: If thou eat, if thou drink, if thou marry, if thou travel, do all in the Name of God, that is, calling Him to aid thee: in everything first praying to Him, so take hold of thy business.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:171
verses.text: Wouldest thou speak somewhat? Set this in front.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:172
verses.text: For this cause we also place in front of our epistles the Name of the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:173
verses.text: Wheresoever the Name of God is, all is auspicious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:174
verses.text: For if the names of Consuls make writings sure, much more doth the Name of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:175
verses.text: Or he means this; after God say ye and do everything, do not introduce the Angels besides.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:176
verses.text: Dost thou eat? Give thanks to God both before and afterwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:177
verses.text: Dost thou sleep? Give thanks to God both before and afterwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:178
verses.text: Launchest thou into the forum? Do the same—nothing worldly, nothing of this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:179
verses.text: Do all in the Name of the Lord, and all shall be prospered to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:180
verses.text: Whereonsoever the Name is placed, there all things are auspicious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:181
verses.text: If it casts out devils, if it drives away diseases, much more does it render business easy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:182
verses.text: And what is to "do in word or in deed"? Either requesting or performing anything whatever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:183
verses.text: Hear how in the Name of God Abraham sent his servant; David in the Name of God slew Goliath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:184
verses.text: Marvelous is His Name and great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:185
verses.text: Again, Jacob sending his sons saith, "My God give you favor in the sight of the man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:186
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:187
verses.text: xliii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:188
verses.text: ) For he that doeth this hath for his ally, God, without whom he durst do nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:189
verses.text: As honored then by being called upon, He will in turn honor by making their business easy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:190
verses.text: Invoke the Son, give thanks to the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:191
verses.text: For when the Son is invoked, the Father is invoked, and when He is thanked, the Son has been thanked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:192
verses.text: These things let us learn, not as far as words only, but to fulfill them also by works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:193
verses.text: Nothing is equal to this Name, marvelous is it everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:194
verses.text: "Thy Name," he saith, "is ointment poured forth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:195
verses.text: (Cant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:196
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:197
verses.text: ) He that hath uttered it is straightway filled with fragrance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:198
verses.text: "No man," it is said, "can call Jesus Lord, but by the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:199
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:200
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:201
verses.text: ) So great things doth this Name Work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:202
verses.text: If thou have said, In the Name of Father, and Son, and Holy Ghost, with faith, thou hast accomplished everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:203
verses.text: See, how great things thou hast done! Thou hast created a man, and wrought all the rest (that cometh) of Baptism! So, when used in commanding diseases, terrible is The Name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:204
verses.text: Therefore the devil introduced those of the Angels, envying us the honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:205
verses.text: Such incantations are for the demons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:206
verses.text: Even if it be Angel, even if it be Archangel, even if it be Cherubim, allow it not; for neither will these Powers accept such addresses, but will even toss them away from them, when they have beheld their Master dishonored.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:207
verses.text: "I have honored thee," He saith, "and have said, Call upon Me"; and dost thou dishonor Him? If thou chant this incantation with faith, thou wilt drive away both diseases and demons, and even if thou have failed to drive away the disease, this is not from lack of power, but because it is expedient it should be so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:208
verses.text: "According to Thy greatness," he saith, "so also is Thy praise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:209
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:210
verses.text: xlviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:211
verses.text: ) By this Name hath the world been converted, the tyranny dissolved, the devil trampled on, the heavens opened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:212
verses.text: We have been regenerated by this Name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 10:213
verses.text: This if we have, we beam forth; This maketh both martyrs and confessors; This let us hold fast as a great gift, that we may live in glory, and be well-pleasing to God, and be counted worthy of the good things promised to them that love Him, through the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:1
verses.text: Homily X.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:2
verses.text: Colossians iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:3
verses.text: –  "Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:4
verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:5
verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing inthe Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:6
verses.text: Fathers, provoke not your children, that they be not discouraged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:7
verses.text: Servants, obey in all things them that are your masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing the Lord: whatsoever ye do, work heartily, as unto the Lord, and not unto men; knowing that from the Lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance: ye serve the Lord Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:8
verses.text: For he that doeth wrong shall receive again for the wrong that he hath done: and there is no respect of persons with God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:9
verses.text: ('Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:10
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:12
verses.text: ) Masters, render unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:13
verses.text: Why does he not give these commands everywhere, and in all the Epistles, but only here, and in that to the Ephesians, and that to Timothy, and that to Titus? Because probably there were dissensions in these cities; or probably they were correct in other respects, so that it was expedient they should hear about these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:14
verses.text: Rather, however, what he saith to these, he saith to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:15
verses.text: Now in these things also this Epistle bears great resemblance to that to the Ephesians, either because it was not fitting to write about these things to men now at peace, who needed to be instructed in high doctrines as yet lacking to them, or because that for persons who had been comforted under trials, it were superfluous to hear on these subjects.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:16
verses.text: So that I conjecture, that in this place the Church was now well-grounded, and that these things are said as in finishing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:17
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:18
verses.text: "Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:19
verses.text: That is, be subject for God's sake, because this adorneth you, he saith, not them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:20
verses.text: For I mean not that subjection which is due to a master, nor yet that alone which is of nature, but that for God's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:21
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:22
verses.text: "Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:23
verses.text: See how again he has exhorted to reciprocity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:24
verses.text: As in the other case he enjoineth fear and love, so also doth he here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:25
verses.text: For it is possible for one who loves even, to be bitter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:26
verses.text: What he saith then is this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:27
verses.text: Fight not; for nothing is more bitter than this fighting, when it takes place on the part of the husband toward the wife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:28
verses.text: For the fightings which happen between beloved persons, these are bitter; and he shows that it ariseth from great bitterness, when, saith he, any one is at variance with his own member.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:29
verses.text: To love therefore is the husband's part, to yield pertains to the other side.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:30
verses.text: If then each one contributes his own part, all stands firm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:31
verses.text: From being loved, the wife too becomes loving; and from her being submissive, the husband becomes yielding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:32
verses.text: And see how in nature also it hath been so ordered, that the one should love, the other obey.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:33
verses.text: For when the party governing loves the governed, then everything stands fast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:34
verses.text: Love from the governed is not so requisite, as from the governing towards the governed; for from the other obedience is due.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:35
verses.text: For that the woman hath beauty, and the man desire, shows nothing else than that for the sake of love it hath been made so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:36
verses.text: Do not therefore, because thy wife is subject to thee, act the despot; nor because thy husband loveth thee, be thou puffed up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:37
verses.text: Let neither the husband's love elate the wife, nor the wife's subjection puff up the husband.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:38
verses.text: For this cause hath He subjected her to thee, that she may be loved the more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:39
verses.text: For this cause He hath made thee to be loved, O wife, that thou mayest easily bear thy subjection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:40
verses.text: Fear not in being a subject; for subjection to one that loveth thee hath no hardship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:41
verses.text: Fear not in loving, for thou hast her yielding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:42
verses.text: In no other way then could a bond have been.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:43
verses.text: Thou hast then thine authority of necessity, proceeding from nature; maintain also the bond that proceedeth from love, for this alloweth the weaker to be endurable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:44
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:45
verses.text: "Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:46
verses.text: Again he has put that, "in the Lord," at once laying down the laws of obedience, and shaming them, and casting them down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:47
verses.text: For this, saith he, is well-pleasing to the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:48
verses.text: See how he would have us do all not from nature only, but, prior to this, from what is pleasing to God, that we may also have reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:49
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:50
verses.text: "Fathers, provoke not your children, that they be not discouraged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:51
verses.text: Lo! again here also is subjection and love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:52
verses.text: And he said not, "Love your children," for it had been superfluous, seeing that nature itself constraineth to this; but what needed correction he corrected; that the love should in this case also be the more vehement, because that the obedience is greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:53
verses.text: For it nowhere lays down as an exemplification the relation of husband and wife; but what? hear the prophet saying, "Like as a father pitieth his children, so the Lord pitied them that fear Him" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:54
verses.text: ciii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:55
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:56
verses.text: ) And again Christ saith, "What man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:57
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:58
verses.text: )  "Fathers, provoke not your children, that they be not discouraged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:59
verses.text: He hath set down what he knew had the greatest power to seize upon them; and whilst commanding them he has spoken more like a friend; and nowhere does he mention God, for he would overcome parents, and bow their tender affections.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:60
verses.text: That is, "Make them not more contentious, there are occasions when you ought even to give way".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:61
verses.text: Next he comes to the third kind of authority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:62
verses.text: There is here also a certain love, but that no more proceeding from nature, as above, but from habit, and from the authority itself, and the works done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:63
verses.text: Seeing then that in this case the sphere of love is narrowed, whilst that of obedience is amplified, he dwelleth upon this, wishing to give to these from their obedience, what the first have from nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:64
verses.text: So that what he discourseth with the servants alone is not for their masters' sakes, but for their own also, that they may make themselves the objects of tender affection to their masters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:65
verses.text: But he sets not this forth openly; for so he would doubtless have made them supine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:66
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:67
verses.text: "Servants," he saith, "obey in all things your masters according to the flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:68
verses.text: And see how always he sets down the names, "wives, children, servants," being at once a just claim upon their obedience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:69
verses.text: But that none might be pained, he added, "to your masters according to the flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:70
verses.text: Thy better part, the soul, is free, he saith; thy service is for a season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:71
verses.text: It therefore do thou subject, that thy service be no more of constraint.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:72
verses.text: "Not with eye-service, as men-pleasers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:73
verses.text: Make, he saith, thy service which is by the law, to be from the fear of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:74
verses.text: For if when thy master seeth thee not, thou doest thy duty and what is for his honor, it is manifest that thou doest it because of the sleepless Eye.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:75
verses.text: "Not with eye-service," he saith, "as men-pleasers"; thus implying, "it is you who will have to sustain the damage".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:76
verses.text: For hear the prophet saying, "God hath scattered the bones of the men-pleasers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:77
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:78
verses.text: liii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:79
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:80
verses.text: ) See then how he spares them, and brings them to order.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:81
verses.text: "But in singleness of heart," he saith, "fearing God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:82
verses.text: For that is not singleness, but hypocrisy, to hold one thing, and act another; to appear one when the master is present, another when he is absent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:83
verses.text: Therefore he said not simply, "in singleness of heart," but, "fearing God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:84
verses.text: For this is to fear God, when, though none be seeing, we do not aught that is evil; but if we do, we fear not God, but men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:85
verses.text: Seest thou how he bringeth them to order?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:86
verses.text: "Whatsoever ye do, work heartily, as unto the Lord, and not unto men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:87
verses.text: He desires to have them freed not only from hypocrisy, but also from slothfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:88
verses.text: He hath made them instead of slaves free, when they need not the superintendence of their master; for the expression "heartily" means this, "with good will," not with a slavish necessity, but with freedom, and of choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:89
verses.text: And what is the reward?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:90
verses.text: "Knowing," he saith, "that from the Lord ye shall receive the recompense of your inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:91
verses.text: For from Him also it is evident that ye shall receive the reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:92
verses.text: And that ye serve the Lord is plain from this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:93
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:94
verses.text: "For he that doeth wrong," he saith, "shall receive again for the wrong that he hath done".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:95
verses.text: Here he confirmeth his former statements.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:96
verses.text: For that his words may not appear to be those of flattery, "he shall receive," he saith, "the wrong he hath done," that is, he shall suffer punishment also, "for there is no respect of persons".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:97
verses.text: For what if thou art a servant? it is no shame to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:98
verses.text: And truly he might have said this to the masters, as he did in the Epistle to the Ephesians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:99
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:100
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:101
verses.text: ) But here he seems to me to be alluding to the Grecian masters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:102
verses.text: For, what if he is a Greek and thou a Christian? Not the persons but the actions are examined, so that even in this case thou oughtest to serve with good will, and heartily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:103
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:104
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:105
verses.text: "Masters, render unto your servants that which is just and equal".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:106
verses.text: What is "just"? What is "equal"? To place them in plenty of everything, and not allow them to stand in need of others, but to recompense them for their labors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:107
verses.text: For, because I have said that they have their reward from God, do not thou therefore deprive them of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:108
verses.text: And in another place he saith, "forbearing threatening" (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:109
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:110
verses.text: ), wishing to make them more gentle; for those were perfect men; that is, "with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:111
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:112
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:113
verses.text: ) And the words, "there is no respect of persons," are spoken with a view to these, but they are assigned to the others, in order that these may receive them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:114
verses.text: For when we have said to one person what is applicable to another, we have not corrected him so much, as the one who is in fault.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:115
verses.text: "Ye also," along with them, he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:116
verses.text: He has here made the service common, for he saith, "knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:117
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:118
verses.text: "Continue in prayer, watching therein with thanksgiving".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:119
verses.text: For, since continuing in prayers frequently makes persons listless, therefore he saith, "watching," that is, sober, not wandering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:120
verses.text: For the devil knoweth, he knoweth, how great a good prayer is; therefore he presseth heavily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:121
verses.text: And Paul also knoweth how careless many are when they pray, wherefore he saith, "continue" in prayer, as of somewhat laborious, "watching therein with thanksgiving".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:122
verses.text: For let this, he saith, be your work, to give thanks in your prayers both for the seen and the unseen, and for His benefits to the willing and unwilling, and for the kingdom, and for hell, and for tribulation, and for refreshment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:123
verses.text: For thus is the custom of the Saints to pray, and to give thanks for the common benefits of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:124
verses.text: I know a certain holy man who prayeth thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:125
verses.text: He used to say nothing before these words, but thus, "We give Thee thanks for all Thy benefits bestowed upon us the unworthy, from the first day until the present, for what we know, and what we know not, for the seen, for the unseen, for those in deed, those in word, those with our wills, those against our wills, for all that have been bestowed upon the unworthy, even us; for tribulations, for refreshments, for hell, for punishment, for the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:126
verses.text: We beseech Thee to keep our soul holy, having a pure conscience; an end worthy of thy lovingkindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:127
verses.text: Thou that lovedst us so as to give Thy Only-Begotten for us, grant us to become worthy of Thy love; give us wisdom in Thy word, and in Thy fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:128
verses.text: Only-Begotten Christ, inspire the strength that is from Thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:129
verses.text: Thou that gavest The Only-Begotten for us, and hast sent Thy Holy Spirit for the remission of our sins, if in aught we have wilfully or unwillingly transgressed, pardon, and impute it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:130
verses.text: Remember all that call upon Thy Name in truth; remember all that wish us well, or the contrary, for we are all men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:131
verses.text: Then having added the Prayer of the Faithful, he there ended; having made that prayer, as a certain crowning part, and a binding together for all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:132
verses.text: For many benefits doth God bestow upon us even against our wills; many also, yea more, without our knowledge even.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:133
verses.text: For when we pray for one thing, and He doeth to us the reverse, it is plain that He doeth us good even when we know it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:134
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:135
verses.text: "Withal praying for us also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:136
verses.text: See his lowlymindedness; he sets himself after them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:137
verses.text: "That God may open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:138
verses.text: He means an entrance, and boldness in speaking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:139
verses.text: Wonderful! The great athlete said not "that I may be freed from my bonds," but being in bonds he exhorted others; and exhorted them for a great object, that himself might get boldness in speaking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:140
verses.text: Both the two are great, both the quality of the person, and of the thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:141
verses.text: Wonderful! how great is the dignity! "The mystery," he saith, "of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:142
verses.text: He shows that nothing was more dearly desired by him than this, to speak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:143
verses.text: "For which I am also in bonds; that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:144
verses.text: (Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:145
verses.text: ) He means with much boldness of speech, and withholding nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:146
verses.text: His bonds display, not obscure him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:147
verses.text: With much boldness he means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:148
verses.text: Tell me, art thou in bonds, and dost thou exhort others? Yea, my bonds give me the greater boldness; but I pray for God's furtherance, for I have heard the voice of Christ saying, "When they deliver you up, be not anxious how or what ye shall speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:149
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:150
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:151
verses.text: ) And see, how he has expressed himself in metaphor, "that God may open to us a door for the word"; (see, how unassuming he is; even in his bonds, how he expresses himself;) that is, that He would soften their hearts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:152
verses.text: Still he said not so; but, "that He would give us boldness"; out of lowlymindedness he thus spoke, and that which he had, he asks to receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:153
verses.text: He shows in this Epistle, why Christ came not in those times, in that he calleth the former things "shadow, but the body," saith he, "is of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:154
verses.text: So that it was necessary they should be formed to habits under the shadow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:155
verses.text: At the same time also he exhibits the greatest proof of the love he bears to them; "in order that ye," he saith, "may hear, for that reason, 'I am in bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:156
verses.text: '" Again he sets before us those bonds of his; which I so greatly love, which rouse up my heart, and always draw me into longing to see Paul bound, and in his bonds writing, and preaching, and baptizing, and catechizing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:157
verses.text: In his bonds he was referred to on behalf of the Churches everywhere; in his bonds he builded up incalculably.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:158
verses.text: Then was he rather at large.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:159
verses.text: For hear him saying, "So that most of the brethren being confident through my bonds are more abundantly bold to speak the word without fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:160
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:161
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:162
verses.text: ) And again he makes the same avowal of himself, saying, "For when I am weak, then am I strong".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:163
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:164
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:165
verses.text: ) Wherefore he said also, "But the word of God is not bound".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:166
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:167
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:168
verses.text: ) He was bound with malefactors, with prisoners, with murderers; he, the teacher of the world, he that had ascended into the third heaven, that had heard the unspeakable words, was bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:169
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:170
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:171
verses.text: ) But then was his course the swifter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:172
verses.text: He that was bound, was now loosed; he that was unbound, was bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:173
verses.text: For he indeed was doing what he would; whilst the other prevented him not, nor accomplished his own purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:174
verses.text: What art thou about, O senseless one? Thinkest thou he is a fleshly runner? Doth he strive in our race-course? His course of life is in heaven; him that runneth in heaven, things on earth cannot bind nor hold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:175
verses.text: Seest thou not this sun? Enclose his beams with fetters! stay him from his course! Thou canst not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:176
verses.text: Then neither canst thou Paul! Yea, much less this one than that, for this enjoyeth more of Providence than that, seeing he beareth to us light, not such as that is, but the true.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:177
verses.text: Where now are they who are unwilling to suffer aught for Christ? But why do I say "suffer," seeing that they are unwilling even to give up their wealth? In time past Paul also used to bind, and cast into prison; but since he is become Christ's servant, he glorieth no more of doing, but of suffering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:178
verses.text: And this, moreover, is marvelous in the Preaching, when it is thus raised up and increased by the sufferers themselves, and not by the persecutors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:179
verses.text: Where hath any seen such contests as this? He that suffereth ill, conquers; he that doeth ill, is worsted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:180
verses.text: Brighter is this man than the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:181
verses.text: Through bonds the Preaching entered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:182
verses.text: "I am not ashamed" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:183
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:184
verses.text: ), yea, I glory even, he saith, in preaching The Crucified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:185
verses.text: For consider, I pray: the whole world left those who were at large, and went over to those that are bound; turning away from the imprisoners, it honoreth those laden with chains; hating the crucifiers, it worships the Crucified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:186
verses.text: Not the only marvel is it that the preachers were fishermen, that they were ignorant; but that there were also other hindrances, hindrances too by nature; still the increase was all the more abundant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:187
verses.text: Not only was their ignorance no hindrance; but even it itself caused the Preaching to be manifested.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:188
verses.text: For hear Luke saying, "And perceiving that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:189
verses.text: (Acts iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:190
verses.text: ) Not only were bonds no hindrance, but even of itself this made them more confident.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:191
verses.text: Not so bold were the disciples when Paul was at large, as when he was bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:192
verses.text: For he saith, they "are more abundantly bold to speak the word" of God "without fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:193
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:194
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:195
verses.text: ) Where are they that will gainsay the divinity of the Preaching? Was not their ignorance enough to procure them to be condemned? Would it not then in this case too, affright them? For ye know that by these two passions the many are possessed, vainglory and cowardice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:196
verses.text: Suppose their ignorance suffered them not to feel ashamed, still the dangers must have put them in fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:197
verses.text: But, saith one, they wrought miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:198
verses.text: Ye do believe then that they wrought miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:199
verses.text: But did they not work miracles? This is a greater miracle than to work them, if men were drawn to them without miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:200
verses.text: Socrates too amongst the Greeks was put in bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:201
verses.text: What then? Did not his disciples straightway flee to Megara? Assuredly, why not? They admitted his arguments about immortality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:202
verses.text: But see here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:203
verses.text: Paul was put in bonds, and his disciples waxed the more confident, with reason, for they saw that the Preaching was not hindered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:204
verses.text: For, canst thou put the tongue in bonds? hereby chiefly it runneth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:205
verses.text: For as, except thou have bound the feet of a runner, thou hast not prevented him from running; so, except thou have bound the tongue of an evangelist, thou hast not hindered him from running.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:206
verses.text: And as the former, if thou have bound his loins, runneth on the rather, and is supported, so too the latter preacheth the rather, and with greater boldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:207
verses.text: A prisoner is in fear, when there is nothing beyond bonds: but one that despiseth death, how should he be bound? They did the same as if they had put in bonds the shadow of Paul, and had gagged its mouth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:208
verses.text: For it was a fighting with shadows; for he was both more tenderly regretted by his friends, and more reverenced by his enemies, as bearing the prize for courage in his bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:209
verses.text: And a crown binds the head; but it disgraces it not, yea rather, it makes it brilliant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:210
verses.text: Against their wills they crowned him with his chain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:211
verses.text: For, tell me, was it possible he could fear iron, who braved the adamantine gates of death? Come we, beloved, to emulate these bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:212
verses.text: As many of you women as deck yourselves with trinkets of gold, long ye for the bonds of Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:213
verses.text: Not so glitters the collar round your necks, as the grace of these iron bonds gleamed about his soul! If any longs for those, let him hate these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:214
verses.text: For what communion hath softness with courage; tricking out of the body with philosophy? Those bonds Angels reverence, these they even make a mock of; those bonds are wont to draw up from earth to heaven; these bonds draw down to earth from heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:215
verses.text: For in truth these are bonds, not those; those are ornament, these are bonds; these, along with the body, afflict the soul also; those, along with the body, adorn as well the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:216
verses.text: Wouldest thou be convinced that those are ornament? Tell me which would more have won the notice of the spectators? thou or Paul? And why do I say, "thou"? the queen herself who is all bedecked with gold would not have attracted the spectators so much; but if it had chanced that both Paul in his bonds and the queen had entered the Church at the same time, all would have removed their eyes from her to him; and with good reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:217
verses.text: For to see a man of a nature greater than human, and having nought of man, but an angel upon earth, is more admirable than to see a woman decked with finery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:218
verses.text: For such indeed one may see both in theaters, and in pageants, and at baths, and many places; but whoso seeth a man with bonds upon him, and deeming himself to have the greatest of ornaments, and not giving way under his bonds, doth not behold a spectacle of earth, but one worthy of the heavens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:219
verses.text: The soul that is in that way attired looks about,—who hath seen? who not seen?—is filled with pride, is possessed with anxious thoughts, is bound with countless other passions: but he that hath these bonds on him, is without pride: his soul exulteth, is freed from every anxious care, is joyous, hath its gaze on heaven, is clad with wings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:220
verses.text: If any one were to give me the choice of seeing Paul either stooping out of heaven, and uttering his voice, or out of the prison, I would choose the prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:221
verses.text: For they of heaven visit him when he is in the prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:222
verses.text: The bonds of Paul were the bond of the Preaching, that chain of his was its foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:223
verses.text: Long we for those bonds!  And how, some one says, may this be? If we break up and dash in pieces these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:224
verses.text: No good results to us from these bonds, but even harm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:225
verses.text: These will show us as prisoners There; but the bonds of Paul will loose those bonds; she that is bound with these here, with those deathless bonds shall she also be bound There, both hands and feet; she that has been bound with Paul's, shall have them in that day as it were an ornament about her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:226
verses.text: Free both thyself from thy bonds, and the poor man from his hunger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:227
verses.text: Why rivetest thou fast the chains of thy sins? Some one saith, How? When thou wearest gold whilst another is perishing, when thou, to get thee vainglory, takest so much gold, whilst another hast not even what to eat, hast thou not wedged fast thy sins? Put Christ about thee, and not gold; where Mammon is, there Christ is not, where Christ is, there Mammon is not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:228
verses.text: Wouldest not thou put on the King of all Himself? If one had offered thee the purple, and the diadem, wouldest thou not have taken them before all the gold in the world? I give thee not the regal ornaments, but I offer thee to put on the King Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:229
verses.text: And how can one put Christ on, doth any say? Hear Paul saying, "As many of you as were baptized into Christ, did put on Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:230
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:231
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:232
verses.text: ) Hear the Apostolical precept, "Make not provision for the flesh to fulfill the lusts thereof".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:233
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:234
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:235
verses.text: ) Thus doth one put on Christ, if one provide not for the flesh unto its lusts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:236
verses.text: If thou have put on Christ, even the demons will fear thee; but if gold, even men will laugh thee to scorn: if thou have put on Christ, men also will reverence thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:237
verses.text: Wouldest thou appear fair and comely? Be content with the Creator's fashioning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:238
verses.text: Why dost thou overlay these bits of gold, as if about to put to rights God's creation? Wouldest thou appear comely? Clothe thee in alms; clothe thee in benevolence; clothe thee in modesty, humbleness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:239
verses.text: These are all more precious than gold; these make even the beautiful yet more comely; these make even the ill formed to be well formed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:240
verses.text: For when any one looks upon a countenance with good will, he gives his judgment from love; but an evil woman, even though she be beautiful, none can call beautiful; for the mind being confounded pronounceth not its sentence aright.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:241
verses.text: That Egyptian woman of old was adorned; Joseph too was adorned; which of them was the more beautiful? I say not when she was in the palace, and he in the prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:242
verses.text: He was naked, but clothed in the garments of chastity; she was clothed, but more unseemly than if she had been naked; for she had not modesty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:243
verses.text: When thou hast excessively adorned thee, O woman, then thou art become more unseemly than a naked one; for thou hast stripped thee of thy fair adorning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:244
verses.text: Eve also was naked; but when she had clothed herself, then was she more unseemly, for when she was naked indeed, she was adorned with the glory of God; but when she had clothed herself with the garment of sin, then was she unseemly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:245
verses.text: And thou, when arraying thyself in the garment of studied finery, dost then appear more unseemly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:246
verses.text: For that costliness availeth not to make any appear beautiful, but that it is possible even for one dressed out to be even more unseemly than if naked, tell me now; if thou hadst ever put on the dresses of a piper or a flute-player, would it not have been unseemliness? And yet those dresses are of gold; but for this very reason it were unseemliness, because they are of gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:247
verses.text: For the costliness suits well with people on the stage, tragedians, players, mimes, dancers, fighters with wild beasts; but to a woman that is a believer, there are given other robes from God, the Only-Begotten Son of God Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:248
verses.text: "For," he saith, "as many as were baptized into Christ, did put on Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:249
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:250
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:251
verses.text: ) Tell me, if one had given thee kingly apparel, and thou hadst taken a beggar's dress, and put this on above it, wouldest thou not, besides the unseemliness, have also been punished for it? Thou hast put on the Lord of Heaven, and of the Angels, and art thou still busied about earth?  I have spoken thus, because love of ornament is of itself a great evil, even were no other gendered by it, and it were possible to hold it without peril, (for it inciteth to vainglory and to pride,) but now many other evils are gendered by finery, evil suspicions, unseasonable expenses, evil speakings, occasions of rapacity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:252
verses.text: For why dost thou adorn thyself? Tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:253
verses.text: Is it that thou mayest please thy husband? Then do it at home.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:254
verses.text: But here the reverse is the case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:255
verses.text: For if thou wouldest please thine own husband, please not others; but if thou please others, thou wilt not be able to please thine own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:256
verses.text: So that thou shouldest put away all thine ornaments, when thou goest to the forum or proceedest to the church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:257
verses.text: Besides, please not thy husband by those means which harlots use, but by those rather which wives that are free employ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:258
verses.text: For wherein, tell me, doth a wife differ from a harlot? In that the one regardeth one thing only, namely, that by the beauty of her person she may attract to herself him whom she loves; whilst the other both ruleth the house, and shareth in the children, and in all other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:259
verses.text: Hast thou a little daughter? look to it lest she inherit the mischief, for they are wont to form their manners according to their nurture, and to imitate their mothers' behavior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:260
verses.text: Be a pattern to thy daughter of modesty, deck thyself with that adorning, and see that thou despise the other; for that is in truth an ornament, the other a disfigurement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:261
verses.text: Enough has been said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 11:262
verses.text: Now God that made the world, and hath given to us the ornament of the soul, adorn us, and clothe us with His own glory, that all shining brightly in good works, and living unto His glory, we may send up glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit, now and always, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:1
verses.text: Homily XI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:2
verses.text: Colossians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:3
verses.text: ,  "Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:4
verses.text: Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer each one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:5
verses.text: What Christ said to His disciples, that doth Paul also now advise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:6
verses.text: And what did Christ say? "Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:7
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:8
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:9
verses.text: ) That is, be upon your guard, giving them no handle against you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:10
verses.text: For therefore it is added, "towards them that are without," in order that we may know that against our own members we have no need of so much caution as against those without.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:11
verses.text: For where brethren are, there are both many allowances and kindnesses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:12
verses.text: There is indeed need of caution even here; but much more without, for it is not the same to be amongst enemies and foes, and amongst friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:13
verses.text: Then because he had alarmed them, see how again he encourages them; "Redeeming," he saith, "the time": that is, the present time is short.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:14
verses.text: Now this he said, not wishing them to be crafty, nor hypocrites, (for this is not a part of wisdom, but of senselessness,) but what? In matters wherein they harm you not, he means, give them no handle; as he says also, when writing to the Romans, "Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to whom custom, honor to whom honor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:15
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:16
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:17
verses.text: ) On account of the Preaching alone have thou war, he saith, let this war have none other origin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:18
verses.text: For though they were to become our foes for other causes besides, yet neither shall we have a reward, and they will become worse, and will seem to have just complaints against us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:19
verses.text: For instance, if we pay not the tribute, if we render not the honors that are due, if we be not lowly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:20
verses.text: Seest thou not Paul, how submissive he is, where he was not likely to harm the Preaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:21
verses.text: For hear him saying to Agrippa, "I think myself happy, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee, especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:22
verses.text: (Acts xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:24
verses.text: ) But had he thought it his duty to insult the ruler, he would have spoiled everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:25
verses.text: And hear too those of blessed Peter's company, how gently they answer the Jews, saying, "we must obey God rather than men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:26
verses.text: (Acts v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:27
verses.text: ) And yet men who had renounced their own lives, might both have insulted, and have done anything whatever; but for this object they had renounced their lives, not that they might win vainglory, (for that way had been vainglorious,) but that they might preach and speak all things with boldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:28
verses.text: That other course marks want of moderation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:29
verses.text: "Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt"; that is, that this graciousness may not lapse into indifferentism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:30
verses.text: For it is possible to be simply agreeable, it is possible also to be so with due seemliness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:31
verses.text: "That ye may know how ye ought to answer each one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:32
verses.text: So that one ought not to discourse alike to all, Greeks, I mean, and Brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:33
verses.text: By no means, for this were the very extreme of senselessness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:34
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:35
verses.text: "All my affairs shall Tychicus make known unto you, the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-servant in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:36
verses.text: Admirable! how great is the wisdom of Paul! Observe, he doth not put everything into his Epistles, but only things necessary and urgent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:37
verses.text: In the first place, being desirous of not drawing them out to a length; and secondly, to make his messenger more respected, by his having also somewhat to relate; thirdly, showing his own affection towards him; for he would not else have entrusted these communications to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:38
verses.text: Then, there were things which ought not to be declared in writing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:39
verses.text: "The beloved brother," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:40
verses.text: If beloved, he knew all, and he concealed nothing from him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:41
verses.text: "And faithful minister and fellow-servant in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:42
verses.text: If "faithful," he will speak no falsehood; if "a fellow-servant," he hath shared his trials, so that he has brought together from all sides the grounds of trustworthiness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:43
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:44
verses.text: "Whom I have sent unto you for this very purpose".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:45
verses.text: Here he shows his great love, seeing that for this purpose he sent him, and this was the cause of his journey; and so when writing to the Thessalonians, he said, "Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone, and sent Timothy our brother".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:46
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:47
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:49
verses.text: ) And to the Ephesians he sends this very same person, and for the very same cause, "That he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:50
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:51
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:53
verses.text: ) See what he saith, not "that ye might know my estate," but "that I might know yours".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:54
verses.text: So in no place doth he mention what is his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:55
verses.text: He shows that they were in trials too, by the expression, "comfort your hearts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:56
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:57
verses.text: "With Onesimus, the beloved and faithful brother, who is one of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:58
verses.text: They shall make known unto you all things that are done here".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:59
verses.text: Onesimus is the one about whom, writing to Philemon, he said, "Whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the Gospel: but without thy mind I would do nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:60
verses.text: (Philem.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:62
verses.text: ) And he adds too the praise of their city, that they might not only not be ashamed, but even pride themselves on him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:63
verses.text: "Who is one of you," he saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:64
verses.text: "They shall make known unto you all things that are done here".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:65
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:66
verses.text: "Aristarchus my fellow-prisoner saluteth you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:67
verses.text: Nothing can surpass this praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:68
verses.text: This is he that was brought up from Jerusalem with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:69
verses.text: This man hath said a greater thing than the prophets; for they call themselves "strangers and foreigners," but this one calleth himself even a prisoner.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:70
verses.text: Just like a prisoner of war he was dragged up and down, and lay at every one's will to suffer evil of them, yea rather worse even than prisoners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:71
verses.text: For those indeed their enemies, after taking them, treat with much attention, having a care for them as their own property: but Paul, as though an enemy and a foe, all men dragged up and down, beating him, scourging, insulting, and maligning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:72
verses.text: This was a consolation to those also (to whom he wrote), when their master even is in such circumstances.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:73
verses.text: "And Mark, the cousin of Barnabas"; even this man he hath praised still from his relationship, for Barnabas was a great man; "touching whom ye received commandments; if he come unto you, receive him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:74
verses.text: Why? would they not have received him? Yes, but he means, with much attention; and this shows the man to be great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:75
verses.text: Whence they received these commandments, he does not say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:76
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:77
verses.text: "And Jesus which is called Justus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:78
verses.text: This man was probably a Corinthian.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:79
verses.text: Next, he bestows a common praise on all, having already spoken that of each one in particular; "who are of the circumcision: these only are my fellow-workers unto the kingdom of God, men that have been a comfort unto me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Colossians 12:80
